stories.text:
It'a obvious our society is set up, in many areanas, to the advantage of men. Additionally, I think its awesome when people can attain success helping disadvantaged persons.
But, presently, men and women have basically identical credit scores, and single women outpace single men in home ownership by a significant marrgin. Isn't a company designed to help women, specifically, build credit, helping the winning team? Or is there some metric I'm missing that makes this a pressing issue?

stories.text:
Shopify uses a modular monolith architecture built with Ruby on Rails and MySQL.

2021 was their biggest Black Friday Cyber Monday Together with the Google Cloud infrastructure team, they achieved near-perfect uptime while averaging ~30TB/min of egress traffic across our infrastructure. That’s a massive ~43PB/day!

Here are some of the most interesting stats

https://twitter.com/ShopifyEng/status/1465806691543531525
stories.title: Shopify modular monolith scaled to 30 TB per minute during Cyber Monday
